title: Chesapeake Bay Common Fish
description: 10 most common fish in Chesapeake Bay with appearance and fishery rules.

cards.back: Silvery with black spots; Season: May-Oct; Min Length: 15 inches; Limit: 5/day
Silver body with horizontal stripes; Season: Spring-Fall; Min Length: 18 inches; Limit: 2/day
Silvery-white with faint vertical bars; Season: Year-round; No min length; Limit: 30/day
Deep-bodied, silvery with dark spots; Season: Spring; No retention in some areas; Catch and release encouraged
Brownish-silver with black spots; Season: Year-round; No min length; Limit: 30/day
Bluish-green back with silver sides; Season: Spring-Fall; Min Length: 12 inches; Limit: 15/day
Silver body with 6-8 horizontal stripes; Season: Spring; No min length; Limit: 30/day

prompt: Create a deck of the seven most common fish found in the Chesapeake Bay and its estuaries. Include only fish, no shellfish.  Include Spotted Trout in the list.  On the front of each card, put the name of the fish.  On the back, put a brief description of it's appearance and related fishery rules for the species (e.g., Season, Minimum Keep Length, Daily Catch Limit).
